newsitem.title: USA: NE Utils says 162,000 still without power.
newsitem.headline: NE Utils says 162,000 still without power.

text.p: Northeast Utilities said about 162,000 of its 1.9 million electricity customers are still without service early Monday after heavy, wet snows caused trees to knock out power lines and transformers this weekend.
The hardest hit by the pre-winter storm was Connecticut, a company spokesman said, noting about 100,000 customers out of the state's total 1.1 million were without power.
About 12,000 customers are still without power in western Massachusetts, while in New Hampshire there were about 50,000 power outages.
"We hope to cut this number in half by midnight tonight," he said, adding the number of power outages will drop to a few thousand by late Tuesday.
"We may have a few stragglers by Wednesday," he said.
